parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post information.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any specific parliamentary candidate by name, surname, or party affiliation.  The content focuses on encouraging informed voting in general, not endorsing a particular candidate.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and its message ("Don't leave the elections to chance!") is clearly intended for a broad audience, not a specific individual or small group.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. While the post relates to the electoral process, its objective is not to directly influence the vote for or against any particular candidate. The aim is to encourage voters to be informed and make a considered choice.  The website linked, eucucinevotez.eu, suggests a tool for comparing candidates' platforms, further supporting this non-partisan objective.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post's content and style align with citizen journalism or public service announcements. It promotes informed voting without advocating for any specific candidate or party. The involvement of organizations like Konrad-Adenauer-Stiftung further suggests a non-partisan, educational intent.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>Not applicable. The post doesn't express a personal opinion; instead, it presents a general message encouraging informed participation in the electoral process.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1109396610785375</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, while related to the elections, does not constitute electoral propaganda under Article 98 t) of LEGE nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015.  It promotes informed voting, a goal that aligns with the democratic process, but it does not endorse any specific candidate or party. The post's design and message encourage voters to research candidates and make their own decisions, rather than influencing them towards a particular choice. The involvement of reputable organizations further strengthens the non-partisan nature of the campaign.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>DifinePR</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
